snippet: An improvement in the economy and an unusually warm summer led to a 3.2 percent rise in national energy consumption in 2010, the E.P.A. reports.
abstract: An improvement in the economy and an unusually warm summer led to a 3.2 percent rise in national energy consumption in 2010, the E.P.A. reports.

headline.main: U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions Headed Up Again
